TopicTitle: I, er, found an unwinnable situation

Articles.Content:
1) Start a new career mode game with 0 funds and 10% funding rewards.

2) Take the two lowest paying contracts (launch a craft and reach 5000 m).

3) Notice how you can't actually afford a control or science collection system (that is, the Mk1 pod). You also can't fail any the 4 starting contracts, dismiss them, or let them expire.

Fortunately, this is something of a corner case, and playing on 10% of any rewards means you were messing with settings and should know what you're doing. Also, this happens very early on, so it's not like losing 30 s of setup is a big deal.
While I could play on 10% in .25, and it was annoyingly grindy, I figure 10% on .90 is ridiculous. I'm not even going to try it. I'm having tons of fun on 60% Hard mode!

Failure is always an option.

IMO Career mode should be harder, so that you do fail unless you have some grasp of the game mechanics.

I don't know if funds have been rebalanced, but I started on 10% and it does seem a bit more tight than usual.

I don't really see too much of a problem with having a fail state, especially if you're being masochistic with the difficulty settings.

I don't really see too much of a problem with having a fail state, especially if you're being masochistic with the difficulty settings.
Fail states are fine. This is unwinnable (if more by insanity than mistake), so if possible it would be nice for the game to alert you.
This is not exactly a bug, but more of a balance issue, and therefore moved to development discussions.

Or, you know, get your kerbals to do something else other than just sitting around chilling in the astronaut center on our dime. Maybe some normal, low paying, but stable jobs? Pilots can fly commercial planes and stuff, engineer can do field works, and scientist can, well, do sciency things. Maybe?

A quick hack would be to up the advance on the altitude and/or starting contracts, though I'm unsure if that's the best way.

Given how early in the game you reach this state, it's not an issue. You can simply start over. The only loss is the time it took you to select difficulty settings, a flag, and a name. And you'll need to make a different selection on the difficulty settings anyway.
